headline.main: TIDE OF FUGITIVES AT CALCUTTA TURNS; Common Sense and Hunger Prompt Return of Those Who Fled Air Raiders DEPOT TRAFFIC IS NORMAL Shops Beginning to Reopen -- Comparatively Few Departed After Monday Foray

lead_paragraph: CALCUTTA, India, Dec. 30 (Delayed) -- The tide that carried fugitives out of Calcutta after Japanese air raids is beginning to swing back, and for three days there has been a steady trickle of hungry Indians returning. It is happening more quickly and on a larger scale than the authorities had expected.
abstract: India: Calcutta natives who fled Jap air raids return to city
snippet: CALCUTTA, India, Dec. 30 (Delayed) -- The tide that carried fugitives out of Calcutta after Japanese air raids is beginning to swing back, and for three days there has been a steady trickle of hungry Indians returning. It is happening more quickly...

byline.original: By HERBERT L. MATTHEWSWireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES
